instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.TPS51125: What is TPS51125? This is a power chip responsible for the PP3V3_S5,  PP5V_S5,  and PP5V_S3 power rails on many A1278 model Macbooks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> ID help needed
threads.message:
Hi,

I believe that <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> is faulty. The ID is unreadable from the chip its self. I have a couple of donor boards but both <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> already taken. 

I want to order a single chip quickly from a UK seller rather than wait for more donor boards. Will any of these work?

[url]http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/2x-TI-<CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP>-TPS-51125-TI-QFN24-24-PIN-Power-IC-Chip-/111491523498?hash=item19f569a3aa:g:P6UAAOxykmZTNqby[/url]

[url]http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/<CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP>-Texus-instrument-<CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP>-TPS51125RGE-TPS51125RGER-51125-QFN24-/152424351766?hash=item237d330816:g:Ku0AAOSwux5YNNlW[/url]

[url]http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/Texas-Instruments-TPS51125A-TI-Step-Down-Controller-IC-Chip-/121649755362?hash=item1c52e3f4e2:g:a~IAAOSwgkRVUjpC[/url]

Cheers
